_header: Lord god preserve under thy mighty hand / the king the queen the people and this land
_description: A prayer tag for England — one couplet

CamCCC61.Transcription:
Lord god preserve under þy mighty handesOure kyng oure qwene
                    þeyre pepul and þeyre landes
CamCCC61.Facsimiles:
Parkes,  Malcolm B.,  and  Elizabeth Salter.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Troilus and Criseyde. Geoffrey Chaucer. A Facsimile of Corpus Christi
                College Cambridge MS 61.
         Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1978.

CamTCC600.Transcription:
Lord god preserve vnder þy mighty handeÞe Kyng þe
                    Qwene þeire peple and þis lande

BLAdd5467.Transcription:
Lorde god preserve vnder thy myghty hondeOure kynge oure Qwene theire
                    pepull and this lande…

HunEL26A13.Transcription:
Lord god preserue vnder þy mighty handeÞe kynge þe
                    qwene þe people and þis lande
HunEL26A13.Note:
These two lines (6-7) only; ‘Ihesu’ above as
                    heading.
HunEL26A13.Editions:
Dutschke,  C. W. 
             Guide to Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in the Huntington
                Library.
         2 vols. San Marino, CA: Huntington Library, 1989: 1.35.
